Some of the best Indian food I‚Äôve had. The seasoning of the food is well balanced. Really enjoyed it

Went with the wife for a Tuesday night dinner. Had the famous Tandoori Achari Mushrooms - beyond excellent. The dal makhani was great too. Nisar - the gentleman attending to us - ensured we had a great evening. Will be back!

Our server's name was Ninad and he was fabulous. He helped us to navigate our way through the menu, as some of us were less familiar with Indian cuisine. The food and ambiance were awesome and we will definitely be back! Thank you, Ninad!
If you like seasoned food, it is a very decent place. I ate a very good mushroom as starter and a lamb in a delicious sauce as main dish.
My husband and I aren‚Äôt familiar with authentic Indian food so we stuck with what we knew- chicken tika masala and garlic naan. That sauce!!! Omg.

column3: Cosy, Authentic Food with great Service
column4: We love Indian food. Wide variety of vegetarian options and deserts. Flavours were fresh and homemade with decent portions. Great and attentive service. Reasonably priced. Will definitely come back!
It s not even only about food ! The service is just perfect ! Nisar and his team are just doing everything to satisfy you and good is just amazing !

From the street, Spice Symphony doesn't look very inviting - but looks are deceiving! The interior is chic and cozy. Warm hospitality and great service. The food was delicious. We we're so glad we stopped in - give it a try.
Excellent foot. Just enough spice and extraordinary flavor. Had lamb and okra - super. All servers were fabulous - especially Nisar! Will go back!

column3: Great place for a business lunch
column4: This is a great place for a business lunch. It's calm and the lunch menu is very good value; the food is flavourful and fresh, and the staff friendly professional. I would go back without hesitation.

Last night I went with my wife and daughter for dinner. The restaurant is very cozy and the food was superb! Ninad adviced us on what to choose and everything was excellent Ninad and his group made us feel at home.
the place was nice and friendly, food delicious all my friends loved it too we just had to wait for long but it's worse it
Great place Great for Winter dinners Took my beautiful partner Lance there...he enjoyed it. Sometimes having a long dinner and enjoying it....makes a huge difference

column3: Great drinks, great meal and great service!
column4: Excellent meal, good atmosphere. Friendly service and good drinks. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. Ask for Prem.
We had an outstanding evening at Spice Symphony. Staff absolutely professional and we enjoied the cleanliness of the restaurant. It was like eating at a friends house.

Happy to have found this place ! Amazing food, spicy and not, big choice of everything , and the waiters so friendly and helpful with good recommendations, and if you want for outstanding service- ask for Aldi!!! üëçüèªüëçüèªüëçüèª

column3: Good Indian/Chinese food, fast service, reasonably priced
column4: We came here for dinner. Despite having a reserved table we had to wait about 20 minutes but the staff were friendly and the food was excellent and reasonably priced. Overall a positive experience. We would come here again.
Mr.Nasir will assure you of personal detail and engage you in good conversation. Classic textbook hospitality where you can amazing customer service
The food here is so good! Would 100% recommend it while in NYC. They have two locations so make sure you go to the right one if you book a table!

column3: Amazing food in a great atmosphere
column4: Absolutely loved our visit here! Food, service and surroundings were all perfect. Although we are used to Indian cuisine in Scotland our waiter guided us through the menu and made some recommendations. Very attentive staff and food was absolutely amazing! A must try! üëçüèª
We are well acquainted with Indian cuisine and Spice Symphony didn‚Äôt disappoint. Jude and the team were great hosts and the food was delicious. Definitely recommend.

Went after the play. From the moment we entered the staff were just terrific. Our server Aldi suggested an awesome starter -spicey cauliflower. Followed by 2 entrees chickpea and spinach and lamb. The onion nann was great too. Thanx Aldi for a great experience!!
Engaging and unique menu, delicious food, warm hospitality, and most satisfying dining experience! Reasonably priced, would go often if I lived here. Aldi was a charming server!
We had a great dinner here recently - food was exquisite, service was attentive, and the amuse-bouche at the beginngin of the meal was fun. Try the Tandori salmon - particularly tasty!

column3: Repady between a tour and museum visit
column4: A marvelous venue with excellent food and ample serving. On our radar when im the neighborhood again. Definitely worth seeking out.
We love Indian food and are very picky the selection was great with an elegant foodie twist. We were a large group with a small child they were very accommodating and made us feel welcome.

The food here was simply delicious. The meat was falling off the bone, extremely tender, and with great flavour. Everything was perfectly seasoned too. I also appreciated their friendly and prompt service. I'd say the atmosphere was the only lacking thing.
This place is quite small so pretty crowded. We sat at the small bar and shared two appetizers and a main course. This was plenty of food for two people. Very friendly staff and well worth a visit.
Wonderful service, delicious food, friendly and efficient service - I would highly recommended this wonderful Indian restaurant!!

Amazing from the word go! Great Indian amuse bouche. Choose tandoori wings to start and the samosas which were spiced and seasoned to perfection. Lamb rogan josh main superb! Will be coming back next year!
Excellent Indian Food; best I've had in NYC. We went to the smaller restaurant between 31st and 32nd. The staff could not do enough for us
Excellent food and service lovely place and quite of a combination of Indian with other cuisine . Loved it

column3: Friendly service but you pay for what you get
column4: Great location but a little tired on closer inspection. Service was attentive and friendly. The disappointment was the food though but by comparison it‚Äôs not that $$$ so I guess you get what you pay for. Not rushing back.

Tried a wide variety of appetizer and dinner items from the menu, all flavorful, nothing to avoid. Especially recommend the Tandoori Spicy Chicken Wings, Avocado Chicken Kabab, & Lamb Biryani. Aldi helped with selections and provided great service.

Good stuff. 5 Star. Becoming a favorite place when we visit NYC. Good Location, $50 for two no alcohol as we split the chicken marsala with red sauce and shrimp with garlic. Garlic naan was fresh and delicious. Service was excellent, quick delivery of food.

Walking in the door, you are greeted by the sweet aroma of spices and the smiling owner. The service is top notch, the food is delicious and the wine list is more extensive than you‚Äôd expect. Highly recommended.

Spice Symphony was a great choice for us. We were very pleased by the lovely setting and the short distance from our hotel. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Our meal was well prepared and much enjoyed!

column3: Excellent Food and Service in a Pleasant Room
column4: Really fine Indian dining. Flavor, flavor, flavor! Plus, the service was straight-up AMAZING! I will definitely be visiting again.

Very interesting fusion of Indian and Chinese food - especially on the last page of the menu. We had the lollipop chicken - great name- as a starter delicious. Garlic shrimp and chilli chicken for mains - the chicken was particularly good helpful finished service.
Very enjoyable restaurant with attentive service and tasty Indian fare. A little on the pricy side in my opinion but, if they still busy with higher prices they must be doing something right.
They are very welcoming and friendly and take the time to explain all the different dishes. Everything we ordered was delicious and it‚Äôs very nice to see & taste this fusion.
The service is outstanding!!! The staff are very polite and attentive. My family always want to have dinner there when they visit nyc. Thank you Aldi for a pleasant evening!!!
A small but very nice place with polite and service minded staff. The food tasted wonderful. Service swift and impeccable.

Excellent food, friendly staff and very honest prices. From Starters to Desserts, through Main Courses, Wines and Coffee, you would wish you have more space!!! Clean Decoration, relaxed atmosphere and comfortable chairs!!! It is always full...it is better to make a reservation.
A really fantastic Indian restaurant in NYC. Well worth going if you like Indian cuisine. My wife and I had fantastic meal here and will be back.
Really neat place with great food and drinks. Happy to say we were probably the only tourist there at that time, lots of locals. I say that because I often find it to be a good/great sign.

column3: Atmosphere serene, food delicious, and service magnificent!
column4: We so enjoyed our dinner! They are friendly, engaging, and the food is delicious. Strongly recommend this restaurant.
I am bemused by the reviews on here. When we went we found the service brusque and the food very average and definitely not authentic. Go to Amma. It is so much better.

We have found a great Indian Restaurant in New York which fits perfect to our prefered way on how indian dishes need to be served. We will certainly get back to this place and strongly reccomend it. Besides that we experienced very friendly staff.

Roaming around Time Square looking for vegetarian food and found this . Yummy food . We ordered samosa and paneer potato kofta . They gave ur one more starter to try and that was good too . Nice place .
Great Indian food, decent prices and they also had a few Indo Chinese options. Quick and efficient service I liked it

Unbelievably friendly hostess and waitstaff. Helpful with menu. Fair pricing. Great mushroom appetizer. Sharp decor. Chinese and Indian choices for everyone. Right near many hotels and east side of nyc. Had chicken masala and lamb shank special , both with good sauces.
I highly recommend this place. Had a wonderful experience. The flavors were wonderful and the staff is great!

Trip Advisor brought us to Spice Symphony and I'm so glad it did. We loved the saphron martinis! The food was too good and we left stuffed. Our teenage son even ate the sauce with a spoon when we ran out of naan and rice.
Nice place but a bit pricey. Expensive place!Very noisy restaurant. Helpful and friendly staff. Quite a wide range of delicious Indian food.
food was excellent (had peppery chicken dish, more mild lamb dish, garlic nan, some good app i don't recall and side of potatoes), service the same (Aldi was our server). will definitely be back
My friends and I love Indian cuisine and have traveled to India multiple times. We thoroughly enjoyed the food, service and atmosphere at Spice Symphony. Highly recommend!

column3: Great flavorful food and excellent service
column4: Great food that was flavorful and presented well in a modern clean updated space. I thoroughly enjoyed my dining experience. Recommended.

column3: Great food and nice clean place
column4: We came here while in a hurry to fly home. The service was great and fast. Strongly recommend to stop by here if you like Indian food. Positives: Taste Large portions Service Wifi Negatives: Few vegan options (but all the regular ones are here) Nothing.

A really nice Indian in Midtown East. The service was lovely and the food really good. We enjoyed a vindaloo and a tika massala which were both really good. The naan bread was awesome, light and full a flavour.

Customer service is outstanding. Been to several Indian restaurants over the years by far this one exceeds my expectations with the quality of food and service. Most of all for the quality of food it's reasonably priced for the New York area.
All good - no complaints - good food, service and price. Clean and attentive service Close to our hotel
Great food. Quiet and nice. Great staff. Great food. Great ambiance. Wonderful location. Indian food is great.
Something for everyone.....Indian, Chinese, vegan and vegetarian options, wine, amazing service and food. Can't say enough about this place, it stands out above the crowd.
Had a fabulous meal could not fault a thing especially the service from Aldi our waiter definitely recommended

column3: Good quantity, tasty and different menu
column4: Bumped into this place while roaming the streets of NY. Hospitality, menu, quality, quantity, price, all beat my expectations. Must go!
This restaurant is amazing! We were really well looked after from the moment we stepped into the restaurant, 10 out of 10 for service. The food is delicious and perhaps the best curry I have had.
The food is fresh, the service is good and the environment is lovely! Its a win. ONLY issue need some more SWEETS at the end of the meal!
Had a fab dinner here. Beautiful decor, prompt and delightful service and excellent food. Everything was delicious. I'd highly recommend it!
We have been to this restaurant several times and they always delivery great Indian food with deep and intense flavors. Like the atmosphere and service on the 31st street.

I was on a business trip, arrived for spontaneous dinner. Table was available although busy. The waiters were helpful, directed us to what we would best enjoy. Great tasty dishes. Price reasonable, Will come again.

column3: Excellent Indian food with an edge
column4: The Eggplant with coconut, peanut and sesame sauce was amazing! The Tandoori lamb was perfectly made. The drinks are interesting but would skip the saffron martini.
Thank you, Ninad!! Excellent food and service. I used to love the previous restaurant that was in this space but this is FAR better. Delicious flavors, moist meats, just wonderful. Highly recommend!!
Well looked after by our waiter Aldi, the food was excellent and we had a lovely table. A great finish to our New York visit.

column3: Each dish had its own flavor
column4: So often the Indian dishes have a homogeneous taste. Not here. Each dish had a unique and wonderful flavor. We will definitely come back. Good service.
Great food . The nicest tastiest lamb vindaloo ever.Accompanied by gorgeous garlic naan . Dev was a pleasure to talk to.Very friendly staff . Highly highly recommend 11 out of 10.
Happened upon this okay last minute because it was near my hotel - superb service food atmosphere - I come to NYC often and will definitely come back here
Great food - great service. Prem (owner) and Amit who was our key person orchestrating the service were excellent in their service. All the support staff were well organized.
I had a chicken korma and my dad had a lamb masala which were both brilliant. Nice atmosphere and friendly people, would recommend for a good Indian in New York.
The menu is very rich and we loved everything we have eaten. Staff were polite. The place and the songs during the dinner were pretty pleasant. Prices are ok. I really would like to visit again!
Probably the best Indian food I've ever had outside of my wife's of course. The service was phenomenal. The only thing was the $19 double jack and coke! Yikes! But 5 stars+.

column3: Fantastic food. Excellent, warm and welcoming service. Thanks, Ravi!!
column4: After years of searching we've found the excellent Indian food, service and experience we've been looking for. Thank you, Ravi, for your warm welcome.

Lamb vindaloo, shrimp patia, naan and raita. Fantastic flavours and great service. Excellent wines as well. It was busy and we waited, even with a reservation, but it was more than worth it! Thanks Aldi for the excellent service.

Little gem in the heart of New York. Staff friendly, knowledgeable and helpful with selection from the menu. Dishes were full of flavour and reasonable prices compared to the surrounding choices. Recommended.
Besides the food being terrific, the waitstaff could not have been more accommodating. Our server Aldi made it a special occasion for us. We will return when we are back in New York.
We enjoyed a great dinner with perfect service in pleasent athmosphere. Best restaurant we have been so far in the US.
On a whim, stopped in for dinner w/ my family. What a great ending to a fun day! Great food, even better service! Friendly & relaxed!

Aldi took great care of me on my recent visit; he checked that the spice level of what I was ordering wouldn't be too high. The meal was delicious. My only regret was that I couldn't finish my meal; the portion sizes are pretty healthy.
We were well taken care of, specially Aldi who was very assertive in his recommendations. The food was excellent, cooked to perfection. Will go back on my next trip to NY.
My family and I wanted to try Indian and decided on the spice symphony. We definitely weren't disappointed. We all opted for the Chinese indian fusion dishes and loved them all.
Went there after TRIPADVISOR rating was higher than accent. QUITE AVERAGE FOOD.....maybe the Chef had a bad day...... even roti looked like Naan..... staff was quite decent though.....
I've been in the restaurant with my family and we had so much fun.the service was great and the food was even better! If you're searching for some good Indian food this is the place.

column3: Great food and service - lovely atmosphere
column4: We went to Spice Symphony to take our son and his friend who are working in NYC for the summer to dinner. The food and service was great. We loved all of the dishes we ordered from appetizers to dessert and chai tea.

Had chicken vindaloo, chicken tikka masala, saag paneer and lamb. everything was delicious. will definitely return though wish this were in our neighborhood on the upper east side. glad we found this spot. went by other reviewers reviews and we were not disappointed.
Very nice restaurant great stuff perfect food wise in my room in place and should not mess with you like spicy food and Indian cuisine

My family of 5 plus my vegetarian mum have just eaten here and had a really good meal. The service was very attentive without imposing. I had a great beer recommended by Aldi. We have 4 days left in NY and may well go back.
Great food at good price in a nice interior with very nice and helpful staff (Aldi in particular), 5/5, would visit again!

column3: wonderful place to eat out of the crowd
column4: very nice, high class, we especially liked the chicken with avocado tanduri and the onion filled nan. for vegi, go with the grilled vegetables.

We had a great food and service at this restaurant. After a long day in lower Manhattan, having Indian meal here was great. Specially all the great service and treatment that we received from Aldi. I recommend everyone to ask for Aldi.
Aldi, was very good and service was excellent and food was so good. The ambiance of restaurant was very nice. Everybody was really good. Good job!

Very clean and waiters attentive.The variety of food we had was super :the spinach (palak paneer),the cauliflower(aloo gobi),chic peas(channa masala),string beans(beans poriyal)little spice..,roasted eggplant(baigan bhurta),avocado chicken kebab,chicken tikka masala and chicken malai seekh ,tandoori roti,lentis(yellow dal tarka),cottage cheese with spices(paneer chili dry).
The best indian food we've ever had and a fantastic service and nice staff! We highly recommend this place.
The meal was great, the service too. A must if you are in Manhattan. Aldi supported us very good with his fabulous customer orientation.
Some of the best Indian cuisine I have experienced Chicken tikka masala superb Vegetable curry with nan great Flavors Great service reasonable price , will definitely return
Excellent food and service. Highly recommend. We were all complementing the food and service. Great menu and my daughter is vegan and she loved the vegan options in their menu.

Great value for money. Friendly staff. Service was quick and efficient. Great food with enough variety. The cuisine offered is both Indian and Chinese. You can always decide how spicey you want things. The interior was clean but furniture was basic.
The shrimp tandoori is the best I've ever had! Spinach Chaat and Achari Mushrooms are perfection. Service was pretty good.

column3: Excellent Indian food at a good price
column4: Aldi was our server and he was fantastic. Took care of our every need. Very good food and at a very good price for New York City. The lamb vindaloo is very spicy.

We had a delightful dinner here while staying at the also outstanding San Carlos Hotel next door. Menu had many excellent choices (check their website) and the service was outstanding. The professional capability of all employees really shows. We'll return, that's for sure.

This is a great little restaurant that served a nice variety of Indian food Not sure why the menu contains some Chinese items? I would like to see more variety in their beer offerings Service was excellent
Stop by during stay in NY .Had diner with friends .Good service .Excellent food . Not expensive at all..Best meal during our stay.
BEST paneer I have ever had. Food was great, server took good care of us. Forgot a glass of wine--had to ask again. We ordered a specialty Naan and they gave us plain naan. All in all it was good.

On a family holiday from the UK and decided to try Spice Symphony. We ordered lots of dishes that we shared. The food was gorgeous and the staff were so lovely and attentive. Was really impressed, thank you for such a lovely meal.
We visited this with 2 people not sure about Indian food. The staff were very helpful and could not have been more obliging. Nothing was a problem and we had an enjoyable evening.
Great sampler, good explanation of each dish, very good service and made you feel welcomed. Will go back for dinner next time I am in midtown.

Aldi took care of us. Very good food. We enjoyed the lovely ambiance and a complimentary appetizer. As our friends couldn't take the heat, we ordered mild. We all enjoyed our "comfort" food and champagne.
The food is really fantastic here and the staff is super friendly and flexible. The place is very nice and not too expensive. Don't miss out! There are two Spice Symphony in NYC, equally good!

After several days of eating overpriced, marginal food in midtown, this place was a breath of fresh air, a validation that NYC is one of the world's top culinary destinations. The food was extraordinary, the four dishes we sampled were each unique and delicious.

Went for a dinner in this quiet restaurant. It was so quite that how it can be operated even. Food, lamb and chicken was tasty - perhaps a bit too spicy to our taste. Would recommend to ask spiciness beforehand.
The food was absolutely amazing. I cannot emphasise how exquisite the food tasted. Service was also superb.

Had dinner here before heading to a show. Beautiful restaurant with very attentive staff. Food was excellent if you like Indian food it's a must visit. I'm looking forward to going back when I visit NYC again in July !!!
The restaurant is attached to San Carlos and I believe it is independently owned and run. Great service, friendly staff and a family member knows Indian food and he said it was quite authentic.
Great food and service. This place didn't disappoint, everything we ate (and we ate a lot) was superb. Would def go here next time I'm in NYC.
Very friendly staff. Lunch menu with appetisers, main course and dessert for around 10 usd. Very tasty!

Returned to Spice Symphony after visiting 3 years ago. This visit did not disappoint. It was perfect in every way. Wonderful food, lovely surroundings, attentive staff and delicious wine. We hope to go again before returning home!

column3: Nice service but not worth a second visit.
column4: The service was solicitous, food was good but certainly nothing special. The dishes were plated in a lovely Western way but the tastes were no better than at the much less expensive Indian restaurants in "Curry Hill." Samosas were ordinary.
Nice people but we walked out after sitting down for 5 minutes.. Depressing atmosphere. Sticky menus. Could use a good cleaning and fresh paint.
Great service, delicious food, lovely friendly atmosphere......the best curry I have ever eaten! Couldn't recommend it more highly :-)
Good indian food, reasonable prices, aldi the waiter recommended great dishes, lamb shank was delicious
A repeat while visiting Manhattan. I love the food at this restaurant. Masala and curry plates were great. Outstanding service Nice ambience Price right
Knew I wanted my favorite dish and waiter had great suggestions for sides to compliment. Friendly, fast service and GREAT authentic Indian food! Enjoy!

column3: Don't let the exterior fool you!
column4: Excellent Indian-Chinese food! We were really surprised and probably wouldn't have gone in if I hadn't read some good reviews and it was adjoining our hotel. Boy are we glad we did! Perfectly spiced, not greasy, really just delicious
The staff is amazing and the food is perfect! Aldi took very good care os my family and made perfect suggestions t√¥ match our needs and tastes! Hopefully we Will be back soon! :)

column3: My new word of the day....beyond!! The flavors, the unique dishes, and sweet caring of the staff!
column4: Incredible flavors, great choices of wine, terrific menu providing many options for all types of diners. And you can tell, in a city with many options, this place aims to please. Simply a delight for all your sences.
Food was great, the restaurant was very accommodating to our requests and our server Alain(?) answered all our questions. It was a wonderful start to our NYC spring break vacation!!!

column3: Great choice for dinner in midtown
column4: We had a spectacular meal. The server offered suggestions and the chicken appetizer he recommended was truly amazing. All of us had food to bring home and they have a decent bar also. Would go again if I'm in midtown

Spice Symphony was a great experience all round. Great service, good vibe and tasty food. Food came fast, and the breads are all freshly baked. I would definitely recommend this place for indian food which has a taste of authenticity.
Celebrated a birthday with my family. The quality and flavorful food was only surpassed by the outstanding service. The menu is diverse with unique options for all appetites. Highly recommend.

The food and service were great. I am a big fan of Rogan Josh and it met my expectations. The only disappointing thing was that it contained a little portion of lamb. I am used to an abundance of lamb in a portion.

We wanted to eat Indian food in NYC. After checking several Indian restaurants on internet we did choose Spice Symphony. And it was a really good choice. Atmosphere, food and the service were excellent. I highly recommend this restaurant.
The best Indian food that I've had outside of India, no complaints at all. Amazing service, nice music, absolutely amazing food. Just go!

column3: Good food, pairing wine good advice
column4: Found the place with TripAdvisor. The reviews are telling the truth. Pre mesh helps use with our choices and made several very good suggestions including the wine! Awesome!
We visited the restaurant with 6 persons and everybody liked it. Friendly staff, price was good and enough choice. More importantly the food was so good!

We went to the location on 50th, Doesn't look like much from outside but nice inside. Started with Somosa's, were very good. Had the Chicken Tikka, flavor awesome and good portion for the price. Usually NYC would be expensive, but this wasn't. Highly recommend!
The place is rather small and crowded but it's not annoying. The food is simply fantastic. One of the best indian restaurants I have ever been. Really worth going there.
Great food, fantastic service, very sympathetic and very good price !! Keep it up and will definitely recommend to all spanish visitors

column3: Intimate Indian Restaurant in the heat of Manhattan
column4: A nice rare find in the city. This place has your standard varied Indian menu of lamb, chicken, and veg dishes. The cocktails were well made, the service was quick, and the prices were very good for NYC.
What a wonderful and flavorful meal! I am a vegetarian, and I was very pleased with the menu (lots of fish and chicken dishes too). They offer excellent service and fair prices. Enjoy...
The food was good, tasty and nice spiced The service was good and friendly and I was impressed. I'll def go back!!!

Ate dinner here last night with my foreign exchange student from Indonesia. We were both impressed with the quality of food, service and ambience. They have really mastered every aspect of service and their music selection was perfect.

Not your ordinary Indian restaurant due to a huge variety in the menu, but not ordinary restaurant due to the special service given. We have Aldi to thank for helping us with a great experience. Will definitely be back!

Good food, good variety, and friendly staff, however, a little overpriced in my opinion. Atmosphere was very nice and while you may want to make reservations, I didn't and was still able to get in without a wait. (around 7:30pm)
Breads were excellent , lamp was good with the sauce , samosas were ok , prices are reasonable , good service

column3: excellent indian food. Great food and wine. Very good service.
column4: Loved the chicken vindaloo, garlic nan were great! very good for us that this great restaurant were just in the area of our hotel.

column3: One of the best Indian restaurant I ever been!
column4: Just a random visit but we had really good food. Especially the chicken curry! One of the best curry I ever ate. The service is absolutely stunning!
Dropped in for a quick lunch between meetings. The paneer chilli, beg spring rolls and rasmalai were really good!

Visiting NYC with friends (3couples), went here on Saturday night, 18th Match and had an amazing meal, flavours delicious.....Rogan josh divine and excellent attentive staff! Will definitely return when I'm back in NYC!
Very friendly staff, amazing great quality classic food. Couldn't get enough of the flavours, definitely one of the better Indian restaurants i have come across in the past few years!

column3: Food is good, place is lively and decor well done
column4: We chose Spice Symphony based on reviews and location - on the same block as our hotel. Honestly, I have had better Indian food, but it was solid. And the staff was friendly, even if the service was a bit slow.

Simply incredible. Best Indian food I've had. Great spicy food and some less spicy stuff (butter chicken for the kids). Service was good. Loved the chicken vindaloo and lamb korma. Somosas were awesome. Eat there!
One of the best Indian restaurants in New York. Service and food and wine are all perfection. Try it. You will love it here.
Definitely a 'find'! A fabulous Indian restaurant with great food and ambiance at a reasonable price. Curries and naan were excellent; service was good.
In England this would just be a middle of the road indian restaurant where there are surprising waiting times.

Absolutely delicious! Not the cheapest place to eat but still good value as this was one of the best curries I have ever eaten. I had vegetable samosa followed by chicken tikka masala. Great service too
Delicious and flavorful Indian cuisine. Great staff including Aldi and Jud who were attentive and helpful.
Didn't expect to eat curry in New York, a great find, feels little higher end than a U.K. Curry house but It's not too fancy, good service and nice alternative to mid town restaurants.
Had a really good curry in this restaurant with our friends. Good selection all freshly cooked . Normally find curries poor in the USA , but recommend this one.
Love,love Spice symphony 's food! Very much recommend tandoori chicken,lamb chops and garlic naan Beautiful location w great service

Found the restaurant right around the block from my hotel. Had the Shrimp PiriPiri for an appetizer followed by Lamb Vindaloo and a Garlic Naan. Taste was wonderful and spice was perfect. Will be back with friends next time.

column3: Delicious indian food and romantic environment
column4: This was the best indian restaurant I found in NYC. Everything was delicious and the staff was really friendly and helpful. The price was fair and the atmosphere was romantic. I had a perfect dinner night with my wife.
When we walked in the door, my husband and I both said, "This place smells wonderful!" The food was amazing and our server Aldi took exceelent care of us. I will definitely be back!
Just around the corner from the Barclay Intercontinental, great chicken tika marsala, friendly staff, reasonable prices, would go again

column3: Excellent Indian food, nice atmosphere and very attentive service
column4: Spice Symphony took great care of our large group, even after we changed our reservation time. The service continued to be attentive throughout our excellent meal - tried several different dishes and enjoyed them all.
Very good food and nice service provided by Mr Ninad. Pleasurable experience, we recommend everyone to stop by.

Had dinner with a colleague here. Great Indian food; mild or hot it is available. good service and nice friendly staff who brings some yoghurt if the vindaloo is too hot for you. Good value for money; Definately worthwhile to visit near!
It's really a spice symphony, lots of different tastes and good smells, we loved the food. Service is very friendly and kind to tourists.
Love the diverse menu. Great suggestions from our server. Chicken curry is one of the best I've had.

An easy walk from Times Square took us to this highly rated Indian/Asian restaurant. Fairly intimate setting. Food was delicious and will draw us back a few more times to work through the menu. Service was great, thanks Aldi et al!
The food was excellent, staff was very friendly and made sure we had a good experience. The owner was really sweet, we enjoyed sharing memories about India.. We will definitely come back.
We were so pleased with the excellent service and delicious food. Everything that we tried was delicious and we really felt that the staff cared about making our dinner special.

Nice looking on the inside and the staff was very attentive. My wife and I ordered recommendations from our waiter and he was spot on. Very enjoyable evening and I am sure we will go back the next time we are in NYC
The service and food was just great. Our kids were skeptical at first but the waiter suggested some milder dishes and everyone enjoyed themselves.

We have been here twice and both experiences were terrific. This time, I had the lamb chops which were fabulous. The staff is friendly and helpful, the decor is modestly upscale. Every dish was either very good or excellent.
This restaurant was fantastic. Our waiter, Aldi, was spot on with recommendations, and he gave us great service. Definite recommendation for anyone who likes Indo-Chinese food.

Amazing food and service. Aldi provided excellent advice regarding specials and was extremely attentive during our meal ensuring a seamless dining experience. We would highly recommend this restaurant.

column3: One of the BEST restaurants in NY
column4: I saw all the positive posts on tripadvisor and wasn't dissapointed. What a great restaurant, service and flavours. definitely coming back next time.
The experince was topp shelf from begining to end. The atmosphere was clean and elegant contemporary , with soft lighting. The staff were very pleasant, helpful and genuine. Highly reccomend.

column3: First rate in so many ways
column4: Excellent indian food. Achari mushrooms, one of their starters is mouthwatering and Indo Chinese food truly authentic. Very friendly service and reasonably priced. Highly recommend.
Great spicy food in a snowy day in New York. We loved the food and the service was exceptional. Samosas were amazing. Unbelievable cocktails - so many choices!
Restaurant is very nicely decorated and designed. Food is great with a mix menu of Hindu and Oriental food. Will come back to try the many dishes. Exquisite.

column3: Wonderful food and friendly staff, a new favorite!
column4: Reasonably priced with very tasty food. Every dish ordered was unique and full of flavour so won't bother to describe them all. Service was friendly and efficient. This will be our new "go to" Indian restaurant in the city.
Located right in Murray Hill this hidden gem was outstanding! Would come back anytime for some delicious Indian cuisine.

Beautiful place with incredible Indian food and impeccable service. We came here after a long day of exploring the city and absolutely loved the Tikki Masala and Goan Fish Curry. Small but good wine list. Will be back!
We love indian food, but this place was absolutely awesome. Even the papadums and rita were super high quality.

Very friendly and relaxed atmosphere, excellent food, delicious flavors, and nice wine to match. Even dishes I am normally not interested in (lamb) tasted amazing. Overall favorite - avocado wrapped chicken - paleo Indian foodie paradise, for sure. Highly recommended, my company was impressed.
One of our best meals in NYC, the staff were very welcoming. Couldn't do enough for us. Great food at a very good price. :)

column3: Nice and pleasant place to stop by
column4: The crew is very welcoming and warm, and the place is very clean and pleasant. I ordered one dish, Samosa, which was abit different in taste than what I use to. But overall, I will sure would like to come back and explore more dishes.

Awesome bar staff, really friendly and personable. Also very knowledgeable about the area. Really awesome bar service and amazing cocktails, I only went for drinks, but it looks like the food is also incredible.

We ate here pre theater. The staff were very thoughtful and accommodating to make sure we got out on time. The service and decor were top notch! Prices were very reasonable for this level of restaurant. Will definitely be back!
If you want to eat a great meal in a city of possible great meals you must come here and eat. Not only was the food great but they were extremely friendly and the manager was really cool.
Great variety of Indian cuisine served in a friendly atmosphere. The owner himself was very friendly and personally made sure the customer, including myself, are happy.
When to have dinner, food was very good, l will come back on my next trip to NYC. Chicken Tikka Masala was very good also Grilled Pork i was very good.
Wonderful food, drinks and very nice server, in special Aldi. I recomend this restaurant in New York City!!
We're a family of 5 with kids 12, 11 and 8. We all had a great meal with outstanding service. If we come to NYC again we will definitely visit! Thanks for a great night.
My fianc√© and I booked because of TripAdvisor reviews and we were pleased we did, food, service and setting all excellent!

Very good. 3 of us split 2 mains, plenty for us. Naan garlic bread excellent as well. Corn/chicken soup VG. Only downside I thought was $4 cokes, as well as a $4 charge for a refill. $75 for 3 w/no alcohol.
Fabulous meal great service and price. Highly recommended. We had chicken tikka masala and lamb Rogan josh both of which were really tasty.
Fantastic food! The samosa's were amazing! The Goan fish curry was mouthwateringly beautiful. The general Taos chicken had a nice spicy twist. The staff attentive and exceedingly helpful

column3: Great Indian food at reasonable prices
column4: Fantastic meal. Priced well. Owner is very personable. They have so much business they had to expand to a second location. It's clear why.
Well spiced, delicious and sumptuous dishes. Service is very friendly. We had a nice moment at their restaurant in midtown.
We got take out as we arrived in NYC late at night, the food was brilliant! Watch out though, there are two locations! We ordered to the wrong one and had to trek for 19 blocks to the other!
Excellent food and service. We had the lamb korma, chicken tikka masala and garlic nahn. The korma was especially good.
Great Indian food. We loved every dish we tried. The service and ambience very good. This place was hopping and we were lucky to get a place at the bar. Highly recommend.

Delicious, great value for money and brilliant service from the team, led by Dev. We had the Rogan Josh and Chicken Tikka Massala with a few sundries. Perfect to warm us up on a cold winter's evening.
We ate here while staying nearby on vacation. The food and service were impeccable, favorites of the table included the lamb Korma and the chicken tandoori.
Familiar atmosphere, delicious food, great service, affordable prices - what do you want more? We will definitely come backüòÉ

Went to Murray Hill few restaurants open on Thanksgiving day ,the hosts were very gracious wanted to try it as they Chinese Indian cuisine especially the Chinese Bhel which is a version of Bhel puri ,very busy friendly people good food
Amazing food & fantastic service, the staff were very efficient and friendly, would recommend to anyone looking for a good curry in NY.

The restaurant was packed when my associates and I arrived for dinner, no reservations. Didn't have to wait long though. Food was very good, service excellent, and the staff very friendly and helpful. Will definitely return when I'm in New York City.

I went here because it was highly recommended on Tripadvisor, and I clearly see why. The staff is friendly and knowledgeable and not afraid to recommend specialties. The food is very flavourful and their cocktails are great. I highly recommend this restaurant.

This was unexpectedly delicious food. The waiter made a great recommendation, given that it was my first experience. The staff in general was very friendly and attentive. Would definitely come back and bring friends/family.

column3: The best food in New York :)
column4: The best food in New York :) Dev i found a good server and a give me good recommendation I came back I give hem 5 start
If you are in new york you should definitely visit this restaurant. The dishes are very tasty, portion sizes are large and the staff are very friendly.

Every course of the lunch special was superb high quality. The dishes are calmed down spice wise which I don't like but tasted complex and wonderful. Attentive service and reasonable prices for Manhattan.
Amazing food and great service. I recommend the chicken Tikka Masala and the garlic naan is the best I have ever had. Try also their Pinot Noir - very good value for money!
One of the best meals we have eaten and we travel a lot! And the price was ridiculous for all we ate! Highly recommended
We went here based on good reviews on trip advisor and we are so glad we did! From appetizers to dessert, excellent food and even better service.

column3: Delicious Indian food with an Asian twist
column4: Very small place so make a reservation - while I did feel a little rushed after our meal was over (this is really a small space) I food was wonderful, wait staff was attentive and the prices are moderate for Midtown Manhattan dinning.
The food is great! The place is a bit noisy but is well worth the experience. The portion are very well served. Brilliant
Great Indian food with a reasonable price in midtown,good atmosphere and good attention. Highly recommended

best indian food ever ! was very pleased with visit being a native indian abroad the food was very original n flavoursome. place is a bit crowded with waiting but once food arrives, it's totally worth the wait!

column3: Very good food and excellent service
column4: Now this is gastronomy! The service is awesome, very friendly staff. The food is great of taste and even the wines are delicious. Would really recommend if you like Indian cuisine!

column3: Excellent food and service, small crowded space
column4: Great Indian food, fresh and unusual. Everyone takes great pride in the place, and the restaurant has a very warm atmosphere. The only down-side is that the space is small and somewhat crowded. Overall wonderful experience.
A small joint for good Indo- Chinese... Great hospitality and service. Love the Gulab Jamun dessert üòç
One of the best Indian restaurants I've ever been to. The food was authentic and delightful. The service was great. I'll definitely be returning any chance I get!

column3: Good quality and selection of food
column4: The restaurant is quite small but was busy when we visited early evening. The menu is extensive and the servers willing to help decipher dishes. The food was of a good quality
Amazing food, great staff, quick service, and we got the food very fast. The best garlic man I have ever tasted! I give it my best recommendation!

I love the atmosphere and the food is amazing. We had a great experience for dinner, especially since we made reservations. We have also gotten their take out, and it is just as good! I highly recommend this restaurant!
Delicious food, starting with the stuffed mushroom and to the amazing lamb rogan josh, chicken tikka masala, and shrimp tandoori. Just as great is the attentive service.
We had an outstanding dinner here. Every dish was well prepared and served graciously. I'd highly recommend the eggplant from the vegetarian portion of the menu.
We had a great family dinner. The food was very good and not too spicy. The staff was very helpful and friendly. Highly recommended! We will come back.

SPICE SYMPHONY is one of the best restaurant for indian style food and Hospitality is good ,all staffs are very good peoples to take care customers . we enjoyed with good and Quality and very taste food .

This is a small restaurant, always very busy but the satff is after each customer, offering good advices and they are friendly and responsive (ask for Dev!). The food was exactly as described by the staff, great taste, we just loved it.
Had dinner with wife and daughter. Food was great they enjoyed the Indian and I liked the Chinese. Great staff and food reasonable. Will definitely go back.
Had an early dinner after a trade show and was delighted at the impeccable service and very good food at this intimate spot. Good wine list and cocktails
The service was excellent , really nice people, we didnt even have to think about what to order!!! Excellent recomendations ( curry best one!!) , wine and even the coctails were very good!!!
Really good food. Staff were first class, very attentive and willing to offer suggestions on what to order. Big thumbs up!
Just an outstanding experience. Even on a Sunday night the restaurant was packed, and after trying the food and service we know why.

Not usually writing reviews, but was really impressed with the quality of the food and service. Lamb was super good, garlic bread also different in a very good way. Will definitely come back next time when I'm in NYC.
Food was delious. Staff very friendly. Was expensive but worth it. Would definitely go back. Highly recommend the restaurant
Theo should be 0,5 in the scale, it wasn't bad but not that good either, pretty expensive though for a bottle of water, nan bread and a Chicken vindaloo 35 USD...

We went for a quick lunch. Great personal attention by waiters and excellent truly Indian food. A small hidden excellent place worth visiting. Apparently they will expand by opening a sister restaurant uptown.

Great food and great service. I had a Korea and it was delicious and mild. My gf had a shrimp dished and was told it was a bit spicy. Trust them if they say it's spicy- hot hot hot. Appetizers were great as well.

Ate here this eve...you need to book! Small Indian/Chinese restaurant . Superb service...and I mean exceptional. Very well looked after and very quick service. One of my favourite meals in New York. You know it's good when people are queuing to get in
Very good food and dining experience. Very small restaurant. The waitstaff were attentive. The food was very delicious.
We dined there this week. Fantastic food and great service all at a reasonable price. One of our better meals in new york.

A small place with amazing Indian food and attentive service. The owner himself addresses each customer personally making him/her feel good. Having some previous experience with Indian restaurants, this one rightfully deserves its reputation.
Excellent food. Small, intimate atmosphere with maybe ten tables max. Probably the best Indian I've ever had.
Excellent food and great service. Small and charming, so recommend to make table reservation. Loved the food, but didn't manage to eat it all, so they offered us to have the rest to-go. Thank you!
This is a great restaurant! Wonderful staff suggesting and helping to order the creative and delicious food. It's a real gem. I suggest reservations.

we were visiting nyc and that we should stop here.Indo Chinese is my fav choice and I enjoyed it. we ordered chicken lollipop and my kids devoured it. I had chicken tikka masala and paneer. my waiter was very attentive. Good food.

column3: Good Indian food with some potential
column4: Good restaurant, the food was mostly very good! The Tikka Masala had a funny taste to it and the Chai wasn't authentic, other than that everything was great. Try the New Zealand Chardonnay!
We have selected it for a dinner. It was very good, the food,the service and the price. We had made a reservation because we did no want to wait. I recommend it for sure.

Picked this place after reading the reviews on Tripadvisor, easy to make a reservation through thier website. Service was great and the food fantastic, definitely some of the best Indian I've had. Well deserving of its high ranking.

column3: Superb Indian Food, Service, and Atmosphere
column4: Despite of coming here because of the excellent reviews, I was surprised by the quality of the place. The food and service were superb. I would recommend it without a doubt.

The food was delicious and the staff was super friendly. The lamb was the best I've ever had. Prices were great, particularly for the wine. Not many places in NYC where you can get a nice glass of wine for $7! We'll be back!
Really lovely and tasty food. Well worth a visit. Staff were very helpful in selecting meals. Let them know what style and heat you like and let them suggest a dish.
The service was very attentive, the food was yummy, and the prices were affordable. Recommended! It fills up, so try a reservation.
We had a great evening there with good service that suggested menus. The food was really good. The cocktails were too expensive. Food price was ok.
The portions were perfect, nicely seasoned and very reasonably priced. Friendly staff if you take the time to talk with them. Would definitely go back when I'm in town.
It was a bit of a wait but the staff promised to take care of us and they did. Great seats, great service, unbelievable food.

column3: Good food covers for bad service
column4: The food is excellent being flavourful and in good quantities. The decor is well used but clean... seating about 30 people. Prices are reasonable. Service is delivered in spurts where you wonder if they've forgotten you again. We will return.
The food was excellent, the staff was very friendly and helpful and the venue was nice and intimate. I think the price level is closer to $$$, but it's worth the money.

As a New Yorker I love to try all different kind of food, especially oriental cuisine and this little restaurant didn't disappoint. If I would describe it in a few words it would be: cozy, spicy and Indian. You should give it a try.
We found this restaurant through tripadvisor. It was close to our hotel. Great service delicious food but the best was the owener. He was friendly and polite. Its worth a visit.

We had a lovely, reasonably priced dinner at Spice Symphony! The wait staff were very attentive and helpful with selections. The wine was reasonably priced. Overall, nice little place within walking distance to Penn Station!

This is probably the best Indian restaurant we have been to. The service was good but the food was even better! Everything was cooked to perfection and we left nothing ! The cocktails slipped down a treat too !!
Nice authentic Indian food. Good price - performance ratio. Friendly staff especially a Remarkable young guy from Mumbai who remembers all orders without making any notes. Will go there again.

Small restaurant but great food and service. I had the best okra of my life here. Will definitely go back for OKRA!!! Only four star because chaat we ordered was bit tasteless and that was disappointing at the beginning. But, everything else was awesome!!

We were looking for something close to our hotel and took a chance without a reservation. They were packed but offered to seat us at the bar for dinner. The food was very good but the service was excellent. Thank you!
A great meal for a great price with great service. Everyone was so helpful making it so easy to understand what we were eating. Small so would suggest making a reservation

Not the largest of restaurants in New York but certainly one of the best. From the initial greeting to the final check nothing is a problem. The food is amazing and this is the reason this is still New Yorks no1 Indain Restaurant.
Definitely worth a visit, lovely food and very courteous staff. Read the reviews first before going and never let us down, hence why I thought I'd post my own review.

Great Hospitality from the owner and staff and we ate great Indian Food, and drunk great beer. I chose chicken (Todays special) - it was great :-) It was a small restaurant so it is smart to book a table.
Cool space with a great atmosphere. Main courses were delicious. We had lamb korma and tandoori prawn. Good selection of drinks as well. Book ahead to guarantee a spot as it gets very busy!
This place was great. Good portion sizes, very helpful and polite staff. It's about a 5/10 min walk from the Empire State Building so in a easy to reach location. Would recommend!

Great staff very helpful great customer care very attentive, and great food ...the naan bread is delicious as were the Goan fish curry and the lamb rogan josh...keep up the good work guys and stay up the trip advisor rankings !!
It was one of the best Indian meals I have had outside India, and they kindly fitted us in despite booking late. Great value for New York.

column3: some of the best indian food i've ever had
column4: this place is small, but amazing. service some of the best i've ever had. manager shook our hands on the way out. lamb to die for. shrimp appetizers magical. drinks equally amazing. loved every bit of it.
Food is excellent . Awesome chicken tikka masala , biryani , yellow dal tadka . Air conditioning is very bad .. Needs to improve .
Amazing atmosphere, great food and very attentive service. It was very comfortable visit and would highly recommend to everyone. Cant wait to go back again

We found this on Trip Advisor & decided to give it a try. We really had a great meal & loved the whole experience. The staff was friendly & very helpful with our dinner choices. It's a small place so go early.
Lovely people, lovely food. Thank you so much for a fantastic dining experience! We will be back. Just make sure to make a reservation to avoid disappointment!
One of the best Indians I've ever had spicy loads of flavour very busy always a good sign only draw back very small menu but again top class food

Delicious food and unbeaten service! Linat (I hope I am spelling right) did a great job suggesting dishes that are now memorable to us. Definitely recommend! Amazing Biryani , finger licking stuffed mushroom and crazy good dessert.
The service is phenomenal ... You will be in a place where every dish is rich in its flavors. Strongly suggest the lamb shank.
We visited whilst staying locally , we pre booked and arrived to a very busy restaurant . However , brilliant staff , good food would recommend. Thank you all ‚ù§Ô∏èüá∫üá∏üá¨üáßüá¨üáß

Wonderful meal with superb service. We had the samosas for starters which were delicious. The peshwari naan was superb and my rogan josh was melt in the mouth. It is a very small restaurant, so I would advise booking.

The staff was so nice and hospitable. the food is wonderful, very flavorful, but not overpowering. I had a wonderful lamb dish with yogurt, as well as bread with garlic. Everything was terrific. I look forward to returning.
best indian food and excellent service! was our firt time and we loved the service eventhough we hadnt done reservation.

column3: One of the best Indian food in nyc
column4: This place has very good Indian food and is a must try in nyc ambience is also good with smiling people if anyone gets a chance must visit
Stopped here for a quick lunch and were amazed by the service and lunch menu. Highly recommended if you are hungry for India Chinese or regular Punjabi food on Lexington Ave!
We had lunch here and enjoyed very much. Staff was accommodating and very helpful. Food was great and good value. We definitely will come again

The chef cooked me a chicken jalfrezi which wasn't on the menu. Absolutely delicious!! The staff were so lovely and took the time to speak to us about our stay on NY. Made sure our food was exactly how we wanted it!!! Amazing!!!!!!
Great samosas and naan, but the tikka masala wasn't very good. Chicken was too tough and dry and the sauce was overly heavy with tomato - it needed more coconut milk.

Very spicy food, not to our taste. Power mad manager, we didn't like the way he treated his staff. More like servants to him than staff. Mixed up our order, however this was rectified in about 15 minutes. Unfortunately we wouldn't recommend.

column3: Name Fits - wonderful rich flavors and superb service
column4: Our dinner at Spice Symphony was wonderful - a highlight of our trip. The welcome was extremely kind and warm but the dine in area is small so reservations are a must. The food was the best Indian food ever!
Being from England we have experienced a few good Indians, but this was fantastic. Great flavour, price and service. Highly recommend
Food: 9 Decor: 5 Staff: 8 The food is excellent and prices are quite reasonable. Loved the lamb chops!

column3: Great food & friendly staff, great sevice
column4: We had a lovely meal, well cooked, fabulous nan bread and chicken tikka marsala excellent portions, very reasonably priced for the area. We waited a while for a table, the restaurant is quite small so if you can, I would recommend you book .

We love restaurants with interesting blends of cuisines. We ordered a mix of appetizers and Indian entrees and were not disappointed. Very good Naan. Service was extremely efficient and attentive. Reasonably priced.
I liked the food very much. The waiters were very friendly, the wine was also very good. Not overpriced. Very recommendable!
Everywere i go.i look for a good indian food. The spice symphony was next to our hotel and i am glad that we have try it. The chiken tikka was the best. Samosa and other dishes were also very good.
We thoroughly enjoyed the dinner recommendations provided by the attentive staff. Many vegetarian options.
Wonderfully rich flavors with excellent service. The goat Bhuna and Kerala fish were authentic and delicious. Not a large dining room so book ahead.
Found the place on Trip Advisor, great food! Very friendly staff and very accommodating. Fresh tasting, and specify the heat to your taste.

column3: Had a great meal at a very reasonable price.
column4: the meal was excellent but the staff were outstanding. they were so friendly and helped you get the best deal for your meal. i will be going back next week, definitely!

column3: Best Indian on the face of the planet!
column4: We loved it! The service was superb and very friendly. The food as out of this world. I highly recommend it. You will come back to NYC just for Spice Symphony alone.

As a lover of Indian food, this was not quite spectacular. It was good but missing some depth of flavor. Reasonably priced. Service great, particularly Jude. It was less fusion more dual. Keep expectations in check. Solid.

We went here for a family dinner when my husband and I were visiting relatives. Food was excellent - great choices, including some new items for us. The children loved the Chinese noodles. Portions were big. Waitstaff was friendly and accommodating. Would go there again.

column3: Very good indian food in NYC
column4: The restaurant is very small, reservation recommanded. The service is very good and the food taste delicious. Overall a very good restaurant that I would recommand to everybody!
Everyone was so helpful. Very flexible and open to questions and "special requests" if what you fancy is not on the menu. Delicious mango lassi. Just what we needed...a taste of home (England üòâ)
excellent food, great service. will definitely go back. great selection and superb flavor. a cozy little corner of heaven in gotham!!
Great and fascinating experience, tasty and special. Only complaint was the wait for the single bathroom.
Spicy? Yes! All in all a great and authentic indian food expirience. Friendly staff, fresh, tasty and well spiced food and also some good wines on the menu.

column3: Next time in NYC, we'll be back!
column4: The atmosphere was cozy and service was fast with excellent recommendations. The garlic naan and butter chicken was amazing!
I was there on Sunday night . Very testy food . Excellent service. Very tiny place and you should make reservations. I will come back.
Food was amazing, surroundings and atmosphere were fantastic. Overall a brilliant experience, will definitely go back!

9th of 10,100 in NYC and it lived up to its reputation. Def book, it's small and in demand. Goat Bhuna and Nawabi Murg Ke Tikke amazing. Cocktails to start were good too. Highly recommend, lovely stuff.

Just left this place, searched trip advisor for good food close to our hotel & followed the reviews to Spice Symphony..foods great, service was great & a line out the door when we left..it's a definite go!!
Hadn't reserved for Sunday dinner, so ate late and had to wait in line for this small popular curry house. Recommend the Kerala fish curry, it was excellent. Staff all very friendly and keen to help.

column3: Great Indian in easy to access street
column4: Very different from what we are used to but great food made in their own unique way, appetizers were a bit pricey
Very attentive wait staff and the food was very traditional Indian food full of flavor. We shared 6 different dishes and enjoyed all of them.
Had a really nice meal in here for my sisters 40th birthday. Small but very friendly place and the food was great.

column3: Surprisingly excellent Indian food in NYC!
column4: Book the place based on the review on trip advisor. We are a family of 6 and we ordered 6 different entrees and every one of them is delicious. Price was reasonable too. Highly recommended!
Great Indian Restaurant find in midtown. Not very big, but clean and nice appearance. Menu not as extensive as some, but the have plenty of Indian favorites and the food was excellent.
This is the best indian restaurant I have ever been. Excellent food, perfect service, great location. 100% recommended.
Our business was presenting at Market week and we had lunch both veg and non veg delivered everyday, superb quality very tasty very authentic Indian cooking highly recommended.

column3: Great Indian restaurant on Murray hill
column4: Had a lovey meal here with a friend from Kolkata. The room is unpretentious but the food is delightful and beautifully presented. The palak paneer was exceptional. We will be back the next time we're in NYC.

column3: Excellent and happy place and great abundant plates !
column4: A jewel and perfect food in a friendly and happy atmosphere. You spot the smiling faces immediately and a glance at the dishes you know you came to the right restaurant here!

Found this through Yelp and very delighted with the choice. Nice service, good menu. Portions are large so beware! I had two dishes, one cauliflower , the other eggplant. Doggy bag necessary. Delicious. Very pleasant dining experience
No words to describe this place, the service and the food is more than beyond. The flavors are just incredible. The waiter was very kind and friendly
Sat at bar and had a great meal of shrimp piri piri, bhuna goat and fresh naan. Nice heat in the shrimp and the goat was cooked perfectly and very tender. Definitely will be back.
Loved the food and everyone was nice but the main thing that stood out was the Saffron Martini. Probably the best cocktail I've ever had.

Very poor service, and location is not good at all. Too many Y/C around , and inside not looks like nice place to dine with family . Foods are not that good, we can get better food in Dallas, TX area.
Reserved a table for a business luncheon; the staff was very attentive, helpful and sweet. The food was delicious! I highly recommend Spice and will be back.
I went there with my brother the food was OK but the place was inconvenient and there was a lot of noise
Wonderful food and service, worth of the rating. Dev took good care of our family with older kids. Good value of money.
We had dinner there because of the reviews and ratings on trip advisor. This restaurant did not disappoint! Ordered some of the specials listed in the reviews. Fish dish was fantastic!
Ask Ninad for Dinner adviceüëçüëç Excellent food and service. Amazing lambshops, and very good chicken tikka masala. Thank you for the best indian food experience for a long time.............

Fresh tasty indian food. After a few days of a few too many burgers, we fancied something different and this definitely delivered. Cute intimate environment, with a concise menu. Service was prompt, personal and attentive. Will definitely return next time we are in NYC!
Wonderful selection of Indian food, service is prompt, super friendly. At least 3 times worth it's price! We'd definitely be back here every time we're in NYC.
Enjoyed a fun girls lunch here on a Friday. Service was excellent and food was very good. Waiter suggested several things for us all to try and share - definitely the way to go!

column3: Everything it's amazing here! MUST TRY
column4: Love,love Spice symphony 's food! Very much recommend tandoori chicken,lamb chops and garlic naan. It's great for couples,parties or even baby shower:) We will be back!
Very nice dinner, great food, very good service as well Friendly staff and cozy location, bustling take out/delivery too

Excellent indian restaurant. Tikka masala is delicious and I do recommend the cheese naan. Staff is gentle and ambient music is relaxing. Tandoori could be a little spicier but is OK. I will be back. Restaurant is cozy.

The food was great, the wait staff was very kind and helpful, providing awesome advice on what to order. The service was also great and they will make any dish you want even if it is not on the menu. Would definitely go back!!
Fantastic service food was fantastic best indian food a have had in a long time the dry chilli paneer is a must would visit again shame this is my last night in this fantastic city

Small place, and VERY attentive service. The waiter was fabulous with my wife's gluten allergy & garlic issues, making recommendations, even from the chef! Food was extremely delicious. Highly recommend
4 of us went here on Wednesday evening. The staff were excellent and the dinner was excellent. We all said we will be back and tell our friends.
Went here in january 15'. It's a small, cozy restaurant, with a nice staff, and excellent choices in the menu.
Perfect service - great food (and extraordinary cocktails) ...follow the recommodations of the waiter :-) Thanks for a wonderful dinner !
This is a small cosy restaurant. The food is authentic and prices correct. Service is timely and waiters where capable of providing the right explanations.
Just excellent. Actully during our vacation in NY this is one of a few restaurants that meet our expectatiions. Very good service, very affortable prices.
Took my two daughters here for a new experience. We all loved the authentic delicious food! Small and intimate w many locals.
I was very impressed by the quality of the food, the speed of service and the overall kindness of the host.
A good experience, new flavors... the price is average. The only bad thing is that the place is so small so, there is no much privacy and the noise is loud.
very surprised with such quality food at budget prices. Very good value Highly recommend this restaurant.
Just really good, even if you aren't a fan of Indian food (try the sweet and sour shrimp, for example).
Very enjoyable meal, a bit chaotic in restaurant as it was very small but it didn't take away from quality of food. Staff very attentive and looked after you.

column3: One of the best Indians restaurant i ever been.
column4: A small restaurant and very simple decoration but yet homey, lovely waiters and superb food. We went there after reading "recommendation from tripadvisor" . This place is rated very high and it did not failed us. The price is reasonable.

column3: Very yummy and the staff was super friendly !
column4: Paneer was awesome ! Garlic naan , doesn't get any better. Food was very good as well . The staff couldn't do enough for you . All under $60. Worth the visit for sure

column3: Visit in a group of 8 - all from the UK and knowledgeable about our curries!
column4: Excellent! We chose Spice Symphony because it was highly rated and we weren't disappointed. Great food and fantastic service. Also near to our hotel - scores well on all counts. Recommend booking as it's very small and busy.

column3: You can see why it's so popular
column4: Six of us had a pre-theatre diinner here and all agreed that the food was excellent. Excellent value for money
Our first piece of advice would be book! This is a tiny place, booking is defo needed! Delicious food, friendly helpful staff. Would defo return and recommend
Loved this place!! Awesome service! Awesome hospitality!! Get the chicken tikka masala spicy and about 4 of those mango margaritas and you will be levitating....
We always search trip advisor before we go so we don't waste time looking round for eateries......not disappointed once again...great meal
Visited Spice Symphony whist on a family holiday in NYC. Small restaurant but clean and comfortable. Very friendly staff and lovely curry. Well worth a visit.
Food was very good Most of the dishes were excellent, a few just very good. Service was very good and friendly. I highly recomment. Price was fair for the amount of food we had.

column3: Best Indian food I've ever had!
column4: I'm a vegetarian, so I've only tried their vegetarian dishes. They are pricey, but extremely delicious and perfectly spiced. It's my favorite Indian restaurant in NYC and Indian is my favorite cuisine. Highly recommend their Baghare Baingan.
Waiter was very helpful and made suggestions on best dishes. Cosy atmosphere. Food was good. Would go back.

We crave Indian Chinese especially after eating the hakka chinese in Toronto, Canada which has some great spots. This place came close to the flavors we have experienced. The Chilli Manchurian is awesome

First I recommend making a reservation because this place is tiny and packed! And for good reason... the food was incredible! I had the chicken avocado kabob with garlic naan. It was such a good meal, I will be back!
Very nice Indian food, came here after reading trip advisor reviews and they're correct. You need reservations as place gets busy.

The service is really excellent here. The owner is very welcoming and makes recommendations from the menu. They use fresh herbs, tender meats, and everything has an authentic Indian taste. We really enjoyed it and will certainly go back.
Delicious Indian food served by a very friendly staff. The portions were big, and the price reasonable. Easy to reserve table online.
This little restaurant is a true find, hidden in the corner of Lexington and 31st. Great food, great service. Thank you Tripadvisor commentators for recommending.

Ate here last night for dinner. What a busy cosy little resturant. The food was fantastic and service extremely attentive. Maybe ring for a reservation as it is so popular. But try it if you love a good curry.

We had an excellent experience at this restaurant - Ninad was an incredible server! We would highly recommend this restaurant. Make sure to make a reservation ahead of time (we used open table). We'll definitely be back!

Myself and my boyfriend have been for food at spice symphony.Been rated really well on trip advisor . Great food, lovely staff extremely accomandating !!Could not fault it at all !! Brilliant little find !!
Everyone at our table of 11 enjoyed their meal. It's a small restaurant but it is packed with flavor. Kudos
In Spice Symphony we experiences delicious variation of usual Indian food. It has been appreciated also by our friends who are not used to spicy or not Mediterranean food.
It's ok but not as great as others have mentioned. Our Tandoori was very dry and Vandaloo wasnt good at all. Naan also wasnt good at alk compared to other naans I had in indian restaurants.

column3: great food and very warm and friendly hosts!!
column4: the food is excellent and the staff are very friendly and kind!! Food is awesome!! the ambeince is great and the drinks were awesome!!
We went at lunchtime and I don't understand why we were the only people in here as the food was great and so was the service.
Went with my girlfriend, and had our best meal of the week in this cozy little restaurant. Really great Indian food. And superb service. Recommended!
Amazing service and fantastic food, especially the peshwari naan bread! It was so good we ordered some to take home for later!!
Exceptionally well prepared food. The lamb vindaloo was without exception the best I've ever had. Thoroughly recommended!

column3: Best Indian Food Since I Moved From Wash DC
column4: I ate here for lunch with my girlfriend. We ordered the most incredible tandoori chicken wings we've ever tasted. The Chicken Biryani and Chicken Tikka Masala were also delicious. Highly recommend. Make sure you order the wings.

An excellent dinner with extremely tasty Indian food. The service was welcoming and very professional , couldn't have been better. The spinach, corn, and mushroom dish was exceptional. Price was reasonable as well.

Food was great, service was great as well and very affordable. Main dishes around $15. They actually work for their tip. Making a reservation is advised because its a small place. Great place to start your evening!
Goods: Good was authentic Indian taste, service was quick and polite Could improve: Ambience for eg. Lighting some soft music
This was the best Indian food I have ever had. The waiter was very helpful and recommended some amazing plates to try. The mushroom appetizer is fantastic. Anyway, you will love this place.
We were ten people dining at Spice Symphony and everybody enjoyed the food. Fresh herbs, tender meats, very delicious.
Great Indian food and very friendly service. Loads og spices and piping hot freshly made breads. Would go there again.
We chose this off a tripadvisor recommendation. Loved it! The service was fantastic and the food was delicious.
The food was delicious and the servers were very friendly and professional. Food was served fast and was rich in flavors.
We loved this place. Food was good, service was great, very attentive and responsive. Tip: call ahead to make a reservation, because restaurant is small.
Great Indian food in New York. Waiting staff very helpful and attentive and quick service. Good sized portions.
food was good service was great the food was served quickly kind people it is small but cosy peshwari nan was great

A very small restaurant, but with nice staff and tasty food. Would probably explore other indian establishments before going back, as this was just as much a fusion restaurant with other asian food as well.
I can sum this restaurant up in one word "fantastic" Excellent food Good portions Great service Attentive service Value for money If you like a curry then this is the place for you.....
It was a small yet very classy-cozy restaurant! We ordered Veg Biriyani,aloo paratha and Palak paneer.. The food was authentic and yummy! This place was SO worth it!

column3: Excellent Dinner at a Reasonable Price
column4: Fantastic dinner, fast service, and priced for value. The lamb Rogan Josh was spiced just right, the garlic spinach exceptionally tasty, and the chicken tandoori moist and delicious. Make a reservation on the weekends since the place is small.It'll be worth it.
Really nice service and delicious food. Easy to get a table for a late lunch. I could eat there several times. Suggestion: A more clear/lighting space could be nice for some people, myself included.
food was great. excellent service. fast and attentive. good price. highly recommended this to any one in the area.

column3: Excellent choice found on trip advisor!
column4: Service excellent and staff was so courteous. They advised on what to order and all was delicious! Try the mushroom appetizers! Prices very reasonable. I would both return and recommend. They accept reservations too.

Came here with work friends and we all really enjoyed the food and service. The Lamb Vindaloo was perfectly spiced and the recommended Laccha Paranthas were ideal for mopping up the sauce. Will come again.
Great curry in a lovely setting. Staff friendly and helpful. Felt the menu was a little limited but what we all had we couldn't complain about at all. Would recommend and visit again
it's been a great experience to visit this indian restaurant. we were so impressed by food, as well as the service. overwhelming for sure!
This is a nice neighborhood restaurant, with good food at great prices. Service is fast and friendly. Will return.
Eaten at a lot of Indian restaurants in this city and this is easily one of the best. You must try the Achari Mushrooms. I will be craving these for a longgg time.

column3: Very Good Indian Food in a Modern Setting
column4: The flavors were great, service was professional, and prices reasonable. Authentic Indian Cuisine in the Murray Hill area of Manhattan. Will return.

column3: nice small restaurant with excellent food
column4: really good indian food. nice but small restaurant with friendly stuff. prices are perfect. i really recommend this place.

Lived in India and love their food. This is a tiny restaurant in New York that beats all the competition. Great food, service and pricing. Just love it..not a place to impress the boss but it is excellent value!
Good food, good service. Glad we opted for this place! We had shrimp Piri Piri, Channa Masala, Garlic Naan, Madras Vegetables and Rice Pudding. Loved all of them!
